seo_keywords: Shop Vac bag for drywall dust

problems.title: Blowing Dust out of Exhaust
problems.description: Fine white dust shoots out the back when vacuuming.
possible_causes: Using wrong filter for drywall dust
solution_steps: Ensure the cartridge filter is locked down with the nut.
If vacuuming fine dust (drywall/ash), you MUST use a collection bag in addition to the filter.
Replace the cartridge if it has holes.

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the issue on a 5 Gallon Wet/Dry Vacuum (Classic)?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement part typically costs significantly less than a new $504 vacuum, and extending the life of your Shop-Vac is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my 5 Gallon Wet/Dry Vacuum (Classic) needs a new part?
faqs.answer: Common signs include reduced performance and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the part on my 5 Gallon Wet/Dry Vacuum (Classic) myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
